profile.about:
Ruxandra is one of the familiar faces around the Vancouver community, acting as Director of Marketing for Women Who Code Vancouver since summer 2017, speaker & member of Women Techmakers Vancouver, speaker and champion of #MoveTheDial movement, and having previously mentored with both Lighthouse Labs and Ladies Learning Code.

Ruxandra has been working as a Software Engineer & Architect with TELUS Digital for 3+ years, having had the chance to contribute to or lead multiple projects in the My TELUS and Home Solutions team. As part of the Architecture Support Team, she helped ensure continuous alignment to overall technical vision between the different teams and departments in TELUS.

Following her interest in developer experience, Ruxandra joined CTO.ai in August 2019 as Solutions Architect, where she works with engineering teams and helps design infrastructure solutions and automate devops workflows, involving multiple cloud providers and technologies. 

AWS Certified Solutions Architect (Associate) since December 2019, Ruxandra has also been focusing on expanding her Kubernetes knowledge and experience and has obtained her Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) certification from The Linux Foundation in March 2021.

In her spare time, she is an avid foodie and instagrammer, and loves to read, play tennis, ski, or crochet cute animals.
profile.name: Ruxandra Fediuc

nodes.company: Fractional CTO, Founder of Tech Masters Community, Advocate of all things Open Source, Startup Advisor, Entrepreneur
nodes.name: Ahmad Nassri
nodes.quote:
Ruxandra has shown tremendous growth and aptitude for picking up new topics, learning new skills and taking on large and complex architectural challenges, from helping her team by taking a leadership role through pairing and sharing best practices, into becoming part of the Architecture and Platform team, to help set standards and build developer acceleration tools for a team of 400+ technologists working in a rapid digital transformation environment!

Ruxandra is the ideal technical team leader in having the passion and energy to build and improve technology and people and balancing that with thoughtful and deep understanding of her teammates and the business needs.

I would welcome and look forward to the opportunity to work with Ruxandra again in the future!

nodes.name: Don Burks
nodes.quote:
In each and every case when I have worked with Ruxandra, she has impressed me with the depth and breadth of skill that she has demonstrated. I have found her to be uniquely determined to deliver a high quality of product, and keenly insightful in finding ways to eliminate technical debt and improve her personal and professional performance.

I would recommend Ruxandra for any team, as her knowledge, skills and experience make her a tremendous contributor and a powerful asset.

nodes.company: Senior Product Manager, Enterprise Cloud at Atlassian
nodes.name: Matthew Tse
nodes.quote:
Ruxandra is a force to be reckoned with.

During our time together at TELUS Digital, we worked on a variety of challenging e-commerce and online account management experiences. Most notably, we brought to life an E2E digital experience that enabled TELUS customers the ability to change their internet rate plan online without having to call into the call centre/physically visit a retail store. At the time this was shipped, it was the first of its kind!

As a fullstack software engineer, Ruxandra possesses a very strong technical acumen and is able to navigate both front end and backend technologies with ease. She has a unique ability to balance the technical requirements of a long term product vision and the immediate needs to ship value to customers iteratively.

In the time that we worked together, I could always rely on her to get me up-skilled with the technical challenges of the apps we were building. Her ability to communicate complex technical limitations in a very succinct manner made making trade offs easy.

Overall, Ruxandra is an absolute joy and pleasure to work with. You can’t really ask for much more. But if you do, know that she will exceed all your expectations and then some.

nodes.name: Stacey James
nodes.quote:
I have had the privilege of working with Ruxandra for 4 years now and I can honestly say I take tremendous pride in writing this recommendation. I remember the first meeting we had together, I knew instantly she was going to do amazing things and help our team rise to new levels. Her interest in the team, our goals, how she could help, and immediate contributions were beyond impressive.

Ruxandra's passion, commitment, willingness to try, learn and teach are unsurpassed. She is a strategic thinker and drives the team to find the right solution, recommends alternate options and rallies the team to get things done. She has the trust and respect of her team mates and the leadership team. Ruxandra is truly an amazing addition to any team

nodes.company: Senior Staff Software Architect, Production Engineering at AppDirect
nodes.name: Tom Vogel
nodes.quote:
Working with Ruxandra for the last 3+ years has been a highlight for me. When she first joined my team, working on My TELUS (customer self serve), I knew she was special. 

Ruxandra has an innate capacity to learn... she's a sponge! She quickly ramped up on all of our tooling, and was punching well above her weight for a new hire. Since then I have seen her career skyrocket, as she quickly ramped from her next role as team lead into her current role as one of the most influential architects in the company. 

Her amazing technical abilities is only a small part of the full package. Beyond that, she demonstrates keen soft skills, strong business sense, and is an amazing leader, mentor and entrepreneur in her own right. Ruxandra brings her good humour, humility, empathy and PMA into any circumstance, which makes her an excellent facilitator, and a powerful developer advocate. 

Given more time, I am convinced she will be an absolute juggernaut in the local development scene!

nodes.name: Renée Mak
nodes.quote:
Ruxandra has been, hands down, one of my favourite teammates that I ever had the opportunity to work with. As a designer, I have always been impressed with her ability to work seamlessly with designers and POs. She is able to contextualize tech challenges to team members who don't have a background in software engineering and her attention to detail makes it a breeze to work on solutions together.

I am continuously impressed with her ability to lead and work with a team strongly. She is passionate, kind, funny and working with her feels like working with a friend.

Ruxandra has my highest recommendation and my only regret is that we don't work together anymore!

nodes.name: Calvin Holloway
nodes.quote: Ruxandra and I worked closely to manage an array of responsibilities. She is always looking to learn and is a dedicated teammate who is always putting others first. I feel very fortunate to have had the chance to work with her, she brought a great deal of talent and positive culture to the team. I hope we have the chance to work together again!

nodes.description:
Having joined as co-lead of the Platform Solutions team, Ruxandra supported clients by identifying challenges and limitations in their infrastructure and DevOps processes, optimizing infrastructure solutions, building custom tools to streamline DevOps, and supporting the client engineering teams with adoption. 

Since joining the Platform Engineering team, reporting to the VP of Engineering, Ruxandra has been working directly on the Ops Platform (full-stack), as well as building and maintaining several DevOps oriented open source projects for the company.

• Designed and implemented custom infrastructure & automation solutions with AWS, GCP, CircleCI, BitBucket, Github, etc.
• Active contributor to several company projects: API & Slack integrations (golang), front-end (ReactJS, NextJS), CLI (NodeJS), SDKs (Python, bash, Rust, NodeJS), etc.
• Consistently contributed to CTO.ai customer-facing documentation, from setup instructions to simple tutorials and SDK documentation.
• Built and maintained several open source Ops to showcase usage of the Ops Platform and help users automate infrastructure creation and management (using Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Terraform, etc.).
• Designed, built and ran technical demos and supported sales team for key stakeholders and several industry events, including Amazon ReInvent 2019.

As part of the Board of Directors at Women Who Code Vancouver, launched in 2017 and currently at 2000+ members, Ruxandra helps organize and promote events for the local community, sets up and maintain partnerships with various companies and institutions, and maintains the group's online communication channels. Legacy Director starting 2020.

Women Who Code is the largest and most active community of technical women in the world, with over 250,000 members in 122 countries.

As part of the Platform Architecture Team, reporting directly to the Principal Architect and working closely with him to help ensure continuous alignment to overall technical vision between the different teams and departments in TELUS, Ruxandra developed and maintained the Digital Platform, lead Architecture Reviews, and provided mentorship and feedback to developers across the department.

• Worked closely with the team to maintain and evolve our internal starter kits, core libraries, and CLI tools, built using: NodeJS, ExpressJS, ReactJS, Redux, Contentful CMS, CSS modules & Styled Components, Babel, Webpack, NightwatchJS, StandardJS, Eslint, Saucelabs, Invision, CircleCI, RedHat Openshift, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS, etc.

• Led several explorations of technical tools (CI/CD, Github actions, automated version management & releases, etc.), planned our adoption strategies, and paired with teams to help them adopt the new tools/standards across their projects.

• Maintained several key org-wide technical documentation repositories and helped build a solid documentation and contribution practice within our internal community.

• Facilitated several internal processes and practices meant to encourage collaboration among our multiple teams, avoid duplication, reach consensus on technical decisions, and supported other TELUS teams in their exploration and adoption of the Digital Platform.

TELUS Digital is the team leading the digital evolution at TELUS, Canada's fastest-growing national telecommunications company.

Reporting to the My TELUS Director, as Technology Lead of the My TELUS Home Solutions team, Ruxandra led a team of 4 engineers in charge with maintaining and shipping NodeJS/ExpressJS APIs & ReactJS/Redux web applications for Internet, TV & Home Phone customers, as part of the My TELUS self serve account management platform.

• Worked closely with our Product Owner, Designers, and external teams to help refine the technical requirements and KPIs for the team, and clarify the acceptance criteria for the features to be built by the team.

• Helped organize the development team, by running Developer Roundtable meetings, facilitating collaboration and executing code reviews. Mentored new team members.

• Helped set up, evolve and maintain CI/CD pipelines.

• Collaborated closely with external teams for researching and negotiating APIs design and interfaces, clarifying interdependencies and impact to feature delivery timelines, identifying common risks and opportunities to consolidate work, etc.

• Supported the team as we pioneered the new technology stack and helped identify opportunities and gaps, and migrated existing work from a dated PHP monolith to a Javascript-centric stack focused on scalability, microservices, continuous integration and delivery.

Reporting to the My TELUS Director, Ruxandra was part of an Agile team building and maintaining My TELUS, a PHP/Codeigniter based suite of self-serve account management products for all of TELUS Customers (~2 Million users per month).

• 1st place in TELUS Artificial Intelligence Hackathon (2017) with a React Native app using AI (automated license plate recognition, sentiment analysis, etc.) to help improve bike lane infrastructure, safety and parking enforcement.

• 2nd place in TELUS Digital Website Performance Hackathon (2016).

• Strengthened account management security (2-factor authentication), revamped assisted registration flow, built appointment rescheduling flow, etc.

• Built a variety of new features and flows for TELUS Home Solutions customers and helped maintain and evolve core TELUS applications and backend APIs.

• Core contributor and maintainer of main internal API serving a large number of applications.
Mentored, offered teaching assistance, and evaluated projects for Lighthouse Labs coding bootcamp students: Ruby, Sinatra, Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, ExpressJS, React, etc.

Created, monitored and optimized large-scale, complex e-commerce search engine marketing campaigns; managed three major product categories, covering over 300 campaigns and an average monthly spend of over $200.000. Worked jointly with IT and Merchandising to constantly improve the quality and performance of the landing pages, implement analytics & remarketing tracking, and increase conversion rates.

Cymax is one of the fastest growing online furniture retailers, carrying over 75,000 SKUs and over 200 furniture brands.
Serverless platform on top of K8s that is designed for fast moving development teams who want focus on delivering applications, not managing their delivery operations.
